results.title: Warm strangers
results.creator_credit: Melanie Coombs, AFTRS and Ivan Sen
results.brief_description: At the end of his journey, Jess attempts to reunite with his father whom he has not seen for years. Powerful short from the director of ‘Beneath Clouds’ (2002), Produced by Melanie Coombs (‘Harvey Krumpet’). Original format 16mm/black and white.

results.title: Warm nights on a slow moving train
results.creator_credit: Western Pacific Films, Ross Dimsey, Patric Juillet and Bob Ellis
results.brief_description: Wendy Hughes plays an art teacher employed at a Catholic girls’ convent school from Monday to Friday. At weekends she rides the overnight express train between Sydney and Melbourne as a prostitute in order to keep her addict brother supplied with morphine. Every week she changes her appearance, mannerisms, and personality, luring male clients who always pay and leave by 3 a.m. However, an intelligence agent (Colin Friels) becomes her lover and they team up to murder a politician on the train. Wendy Hughes exudes sensuality, power and passion in the lead role.

results.title: Warlords and Widows the Maronites of Lebanon
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyman”.
This film focuses on the Maronites of Lebanon and is Part Two of a two-part investigation that explores the underlying beliefs, emotions and antagonisms that have resulted in the battles between the Christians and the Islamics of the Middle East.

results.title: Warkamu (A)
results.creator_credit: Ian G Wallis, Abschol Organisation and Monash University
results.brief_description: Studies an Aboriginal community, south of Port Hedland, Western Australia, which supports itself by mining alluvial tin and tantalite-columbite deposits.

results.title: Wardens of Waterton
results.brief_description: Every summer thousands of visitors come to Waterton Lakes National Park to enjoy its mountain grandeur, fishing, swimming, and all the other attractions that make for summer enjoyment. To show how this heritage of beauty and pleasure is preserved year after year, the film takes us on a tour of large-scale outdoor housekeeping. We see not only how wardens organise and administer the Park’s services, but also how they protect wildlife and co-operate with their partners across the border, the rangers of Montana’s Glacier Park.

results.title: War, man's destiny
results.brief_description:
Combines art work, original drawings, and excerpts from classical European paintings in an animated film which recreates the blood contests between the French and Russians in the Napoleonic Wars, and which deplores the horror of war in all times and places. Set with music from Tchaikovsky’s 1812 Overture.
(Awards: Special Jury Prize, Cannes, 1973)

results.title: War without winners
results.creator_credit: Harrold Willens, Center for Defense Information and Haskell Wexler
results.brief_description: In 1979, in cooperation with the Members of Congress for Peace Through Law Education Fund, the Center for Defense Information financed this short documentary to promote the unilateral disarmament lobby’s claim that, “there is no defense against nuclear war,” on which basis they also oppose civil defense programs, anti-ballistic missile defenses and development of satellite-based beam weapons. Combines footage of nuclear tests, presidential speeches and interviews with military leaders with opinions expressed by Russian and American members of the public. Includes President Eisenhower, Jimmy Carter, retired US Navy Admiral La Rocque, former CIA Deputy Director Herbert Scoville and Civil Defense consultant William Kincade. Also includes historical footage of nuclear bomb blast tests in the US desert. Narrated by Paul Newman.

results.title: War without weapons
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnston, Curtis Levy Productions, Film Australia and Curtis Levy
results.brief_description: A behind the scenes look at the Victorian Football League team, North Melbourne, and the preparation and physical build up that goes into getting a team ready for the top Australian Rules Football competition. Ron Barassi, from North Melbourne, is shown in his role as a top VFL coach and we follow the team through its early training sessions to the opening match of the season. Looks at some of the spectacular action from the North Melbourne/Carlton challenge in 1979.

results.title: War stories
results.creator_credit: Gaylene Preston and Gaylene Preston Productions
results.brief_description: A revealing documentary that explores the effects of war beyond the battlefield. Through candid interviews with seven elderly women the impact of World War II on the women who were left behind and the men in their lives is constructed in a series of deeply personal and unexpected stories. Combined with newsreel footage and still photographs, the choice and sequence of the womens’ stories woven together by Gaylene Preston provides a powerful and wide-ranging portrait of New Zealand society and the long repressed emotions provoked by the experience of war. (Awards: Best Film in the New Zealand Film and Television Awards, Official Selection Venice Film Festival, most popular film 1995 Sydney Film Festival)

results.title: War requiem
results.creator_credit: James MacKay, Anglo International Films, British Broadcasting Corporation and Derek Jarman
results.brief_description:
Cinematic interpretation of Benjamin Britten’s 1961 masterly religious/poetic choral oratorio, combining the Latin Mass with several poems by the British war poet Wilfred Owen. Owen was killed on the battlefield a week before the armistice that ended WWI. Jarman merges dramatic sequences, paintings, collages and documentary footage from the wars of the 20th century to evoke the tragedy of war and the untimely death of youth. The film has been interpreted as a metaphor on the war against AIDS. A film without dialogue, featuring Olivier in his final film role.

Credits: James Mackay ; director, writer, Derek Jarman ; photography, Richard Greatrex ; editing, Rick Elgood.
Cast: Laurence Olivier, Tilda Swinton, Nathaniel Parker, Owen Teale, Nigel Terry.
